We can decompose the coupled F bias ( ∆F) into contributions from the stand-alone atmosphere model F bias under realistic surface forcing ( ∆F A) and a coupled F response term ( ∆F R), i.e. ∆F = ∆F A + ∆F R (Fig. 2b). We can estimate ∆F A for any AMIP5 model from its estimated surface flux bias (with the robust assumption that errors in the AMIP5 prescribed surface boundary forcing, including SSTs, are small
24 ). We define ∆F R, which is comprised of all of the coupled feedbacks, as the CMIP5 minus AMIP5 net flux bias difference ( ∆F−∆F A). Our decomposition therefore becomes ∆F = ∆F A + ( ∆F−∆F A), which is clearly valid as the positive and negative ∆F A terms cancel.
